attributes.action: The police, crime, sentencing and courts bill must be stopped.
attributes.additional_details: What counts as annoyance? What counts as too loud? Who actually decides any of this? This bill has not been thought through and has been rushed out of frustration. The jail time they are proposing is absolutely ridiculous, why should a protester get 10 years when most rapists don’t? This proves how incompetent and authoritative the government is, they don’t care about rights, just power.
attributes.background: The wording is to vague, it is rushed and the sentencing is way to brutal. I really want it revoked but i know that won’t happen. So the bill should be less broad and detail what counts as too loud or an “annoyance”, and the jail sentencing should be less severe.

rejection.details:
We have published the following petitions, which you might like to sign:

Do not restrict our rights to peaceful protest: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/579012

Remove single person protest clauses in Police, Crime, Sentencing & Courts Bill: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/578875

Do not pass the Police, Crime, Sentencing and Courts Bill: https://petition.parliament.uk/petitions/579242
